p: With regards to R. alba, the cytotoxicity and genotoxicity of these extracts has been identified in the literature. The essential oil of Bulgarian R. alba L. when tested in concentrations of 250, 500, and 1000 Î¼g/mL exhibited a weak cytotoxic and genotoxic effect in plant cells of H. vulgare [ 77, 78]. No significant increase is observed for the level of mitotic disturbances (micronuclei and aneuploidy effects), as well as no significant effect on the induction of chromatid aberrations, compared to the untreated control.
